channel.title: Tornadoes on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Tornadoes on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Denton TX area tornado of 7 May 2015
item.description: May 7 2015 9:34p Eastern: Live coverage of Texas storms from WFAA 8 ABC "Confirmed tornadoes, hail hit North Texas". Twitter hashtag #txwx and weather service is @NWSFortWorth. Ann Arbor, MI, May 7 2015 8:42p Eastern: Listening right now to the W5NGU repeater on Broadcastify where net control is running an emergency net. Tornadoes on the ground with ham radio operators giving precise locations of the storms and net control calling out spotters to get reports.

item.title: Denver International Airport hit by June 18, 2013 EF-1 tornado, no one hurt
item.description:
Dr Jeff Masters has remarkable radar imagery from Weather Underground, since the storm went directly over the NWS Denver station.
More news coverage: The Washington Post collected photos and video from Twitter. Denver Post: Tornado at Denver International Airport forces diversions, evacuations

item.title: Holiday Inn in Earth City, MO - "No casualties" - St Louis County OEM
item.description: There are multiple rumors on Twitter - as of yet unconfirmed - that KMOV-TV has reported a “mass casualties” event at a Holiday Inn in Earth City, MO as a result of the storms that are going through St Louis on the evening of May 31, 2013. There is not yet any photo evidence or any web page from a reliable source to confirm this. Let’s hope this is just an Internet rumor.
